1.text: What advantage then has the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?

2.text: Much every way: chiefly, because that to them were committed the oracles of God.

3.text: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

4.text: God forbid: yes, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That you might be justified in your sayings, and might overcome when you are judged.

5.text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who takes vengeance? (I speak as a man)

6.text: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

7.text: For if the truth of God has more abounded through my lie to his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

8.text: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.

9.text: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

10.text: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:

11.text: There is none that understands, there is none that seeks after God.

12.text: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that does good, no, not one.

13.text: Their throat is an open sepulcher; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips:

14.text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:

15.text: Their feet are swift to shed blood:

16.text: Destruction and misery are in their ways:

17.text: And the way of peace have they not known:

18.text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

19.text: Now we know that what things soever the law said, it said to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.

20.text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.

21.text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

22.text: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ to all and on all them that believe: for there is no difference:

23.text: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

24.text: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

25.text: Whom God has set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

26.text: To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believes in Jesus.

27.text: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? No: but by the law of faith.

28.text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

29.text: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:

30.text: Seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

31.text: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yes, we establish the law.
